nodes.tooltip: CEO of Net Element. Ambassador to Russia from Grenada
One half of husband and wife team. Swindled investors out of tens of millions. Fled the country in late 2006.
One half of husband and wife team. Swindled investors out of tens of millions. Fled the country in late 2006.
Umbrella name for several of Firer's investment companies.
Merchant account holder for Caviar Bar.
Nasdaq listed company. Stock price has fallen 98% since March, 2013.
One of Firer's credit card processing companies. Named the 2012 fastest growing company in America by Inc. Magazine
Longtime business associate of Firer. Co-conspirator in the Bar Girls scam.
Merchant account agent. Co-conspirator in the Bar Girls scam.
Convicted of embezzling over $14.5 million from Chase Manhattan Bank.
Convicted of $23 million of insurance fraud.

links.relationship: Oleg Firer was arrested for mortgage fraud when he attempted to buy G & G and Victor and Natalia Wolf's former home. Later public records show he eventually succeded in purchasing the company and the home.
Star Capital Fund businesses often invest in Net Element, Unified Payments and other Oleg Firer-connected companies.
One of Firer's credit card processing businesses.
Oleg Firer stated in a deposition that he had met and lunched with Victor Wolf to discuss a loan. Firer stated that he never provided this loan.
Oleg Firer has served as Net Element's CEO since 2013. Firer became CEO when Net Element bought Unified Payments.
Oleg Firer and Felix Filenger are both involved with the Chabad Russian Center of South Florida. Firer submitted a letter of support to the judge in Filenger's insurance fraud case.

Companies associated with Michael Wachs and his relatives purchased millions of dollars worth of stock from Net Element. One of these companies, Crede CG III, is currently being prosecuted for stock price manipulation.
Net Element purchased Oleg Firer's Unified Payments in March 2013. Credit card processing continues to represent the lion's share of Net Element's revenue.
Albert Takhalov runs Discover Data, a registered agent of Unified Payments. Part of his job is to source merchants and plug them into Unified Payments credit card processing system.

Natalia Wolf entered into a $2.6 million mortgage agreement with G & G in early 2006. Within two and a half months, she added her home to the loan as extra collateral and subsequently transfered the home outright to G & G "in lieu of foreclosure" on the original mortgage.

Victor and Natalia Wolf wined and dined prospective investors in their Eastern Shores home. They made of with tens of millions of dollars and are both listed on the FBI's most wanted list for white collar crime.
Stanislav Pavlenko opened up the merchant account for Caviar Bar with Merchant Processing Services.
Stanislav Pavlenko testified that he was working at Star Capital Fund when he began conspiring in the Bar Girls scam.
Co-conspirators in the Bar Girls scam. Albert Takhalov testified that Stanislav Pavlenko introduced him to Oleg Firer.
